title: Ecological Dynamics-Based Water Safety and Swimming Education Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic swimming skills and general knowledge of water safety
context.additional_context: Weekend/after-school programs for office/administrative professionals, requiring language curriculum integration to strengthen underwater situational judgment and communication skills

learning_goals: Perform self-regulated behaviors using obstacle recognition and efficient breathing strategies in various aquatic environments (pools, lakes, rivers, oceans)
Acquire functional swimming skills (freestyle, backstroke, survival swimming) in indoor pool environments applying ecological dynamics principles
Develop situational decision-making and emotional regulation abilities to increase transferability to open-water environments

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
